intro: Oreocarya virgata, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats. The plant has small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Oreocarya virgata is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in open meadows or on mountain slopes. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
